actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend section 516 of the Tariff Act of 1930.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to furnish to the American manufacturer, producer, or wholesaler, the rate of duty and the additional duty described as "countervailing duties" under the Tariff Act, if any such duty is imposed upon his merchandise. Allows a civil action to be brought in the U.S. Court upon refusal of the Secretary to impose such countervailing duties. Allows the right to contest the Secretary's decesion on appraised value or classification of articles of contervailing duties should be assessed in the U.S. Customs Court. (Amends 19 U.S.C. 1516)

titles.title: A bill to amend section 516 of the Tariff Act of 1930.
